channel.title: statistics on Damien Saunders | Management Marketing Consultant
channel.description: Recent content in statistics on Damien Saunders | Management Marketing Consultant

item.title: Startup Metrics for Pirates (SeedCamp 2008)
item.description: If you're in a Startup you need to agree quite quickly on some of those performance metrics and here, Dave McClure shares his view.

item.title: Why Social Gaming is on the decline? Blame cannibalisation by mobile and OTT
item.description: Social Gaming is on the decline - not terminal decline, just platform cannibalisation.

item.title: Get Results from an Android Mobile Marketing Strategy
item.description: Android Mobiles are taking over the world - and that seems to be supported by the latest statistics or _trends.

item.title: Every Important Stat can be drawn in a 2×2 Grid
item.description: Nolan Chart - XKCD Just to prove a point - the 2×2 grid is the best way to show-off pretty much interesting statistic or insight

item.title: Using Social Media takes 20% of your Australian day
item.description: Australians spend 1 in 5 minutes using social media sites. Social Networking usage was about 22% in December 2010 says comScore.

item.title: 20,000 visitors so far this year
item.description: So its mid-November and I'm just looking at the Google Analytics report to see how I'm getting on.

item.title: Video & Integrated Marketing? Latest Internet Usage Video
item.description: Integrated marketing takes a new turn. This latest viral marketing video focuses on the state of the internet and is essentially a load of stats overlaid with a nice cheesy beat playing.

item.title: Social Media & Marketing Round-up of some good reading
item.description: **The problem with doing research on social media and mobile marketing is the overwhelming amount of noise you get from doing searches on Google, Delicious and Twitter.

item.title: UK album retail sales dip 11% for 2007
item.description: Album unbundling, copyright theft and difficult retail conditions contributed to a drop in album sales of 10.

item.title: UK Digital sales grow by 50% in 2007
item.description: The British Phonographic Industry, which represents the British recorded-music business, said total music download sales for the year topped 77 million, a 50 percent increase over 2006.
